item.title: Stable Diffusion
item.description: On the 22nd of this month, Stability.ai released Stable Diffusion, a free, open-source AI tool for generating images from text prompts (and other images). Previously, access to this technology was available through Open AI’s commercial, invite-only DALL-E 2 platform, Midjourney’s commercial Discord bot, and, in a significantly reduced free-to-use form, Craiyon/DALL-E Mini. Basically, you had to use a hosted service and pay per image, or use something too simple to be much user for anything more than amusing jokes to post on social media.

item.title: On Security Against Time Traveling Adversaries
item.description:
If you had a time machine, what cryptography would you be able to break?
In this work, we investigate the notion of time travel, formally defining models for adversaries equipped with a time machine, and exploring the consequences for cryptography. We find that being able to rewind time breaks some cryptographic schemes, and being able to freely move both forwards and backwards in time breaks even more schemes.
We look at the impacts of time travel on encryption and signatures in particular, finding that the and security games are broken, while and remain secure.
item.author: (Lúcás Críostóir Meier)

item.title: Azure DevOps Podcast: Mathias Brandewinder: Math and Machine Learning using .NET - Episode 208
item.description: Mathias Brandewinder enjoys solving challenging business problems with software engineering and applied mathematics techniques, and some creativity. His current focus is on functional programming with F#, machine learning, and data science, and on putting them together to help companies make smarter decisions with their data. He loves teaching and mentoring, and is a regular speaker at conferences and community events all over the world. A former Microsoft F# MVP, he holds an MS in Operations Research from Stanford, an MS in Economics from University of Paris X, and an MBA from ESSEC. &nbsp; Topics of Discussion: [3:15] Mathias talks about how his love of math got him into programming. [5:57] Mathias discusses what intrigued him about F# and the scripting environment. [6:29] What about when a computer’s version of a number doesn’t really line up with the math version of a number? [11:51] What issues does F# help more than C#? [15:22] What is Mathias’s favorite charting component for .NET? [18:27] What inspired Mathias to write his book, , and is there a new book on the horizon? [20:09] Mathias is here to say math can be genuinely fun! [24:03] Jupiter appears to be an on-the-fly evaluator of code that runs on a server somewhere through the browser. [29:13] What other math-related libraries should we be aware of, and what are some other resources we can check out? &nbsp; Mentioned in this Episode: — New video podcast! (Sponsor) — Available on Amazon! — Follow to stay informed about future events! programming@palermo.net mathias@brandewinder.com &nbsp; Want to Learn More? Visit for show notes and additional episodes.

item.title: Azure Data Explorer Supports Native Ingestion from Amazon S3
item.description: Microsoft recently announced the ability to natively ingest data from Amazon S3 into Azure Data Explorer (ADX). The new feature simplifies multi-cloud data analytics deployments, bringing data from Amazon S3 to Azure, without relying on custom ETL pipelines.

item.title: Dragos Inc. - SkillBridge Project Manager Intern
item.description: Our mission at Dragos is to protect the world’s most critical infrastructure from adversaries who wish to do it harm. Dragos is proud to support transitioning service members from all U.S. military branches to prepare for their post-military careers by providing opportunities to learn and grow their skill sets. We are looking for active duty service members who wish to take their experience and understanding of the value of project management in an agile environment, and can facilitate technical conversations towards a deliverable, to join our team while preparing for their post military career. The project management team is looking for a SkillBridge Project Manager Intern to lead projects that cross IT, Engineering, Security, and Product. As this occurs, the right person will see areas to strategically implement agile best practices and have the opportunity to learn from Dragos teams.

item.title: Dragos Inc. - SkillBridge Reverse/Dissector Engineer Intern
item.description: Our Mission at Dragos is to protect the world’s most critical infrastructure from adversaries who wish to do it harm. We help defend industrial organizations that provide us with the tenets of modern civilization: running water, functioning electricity, and safe industrial working environments. Dragos is proud to support transitioning service members from all U.S. military branches to prepare for their post-military careers by providing opportunities to learn and grow their skill sets. Our Engineering Department is seeking a SkillBridge Reverse/Dissector Engineer Intern to join its Research & Development - Content Engineering Team. In this position, you will work closely with partner teams to support Dragos customers via researching new protocols and detections by working closely with new and existing customers and our solution architects. You will collaborate closely with the Engineering and Intelligence teams to drive insights into industrial protocol analysis, network situationa
